metadata.title: CVE-2020-27814 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-buffer overflow was found in the way openjpeg2 handled certain PNGformat files. An attacker could use this flaw to cause an application crashor in some cases execute arbitrary code with the permission of the userrunning such an application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
